description: Muntham Court is a circular temple or shrine located in what was an Iron Age settlement. Lewis gives it a chronology of mid 1st CE to early 4th CE, but an earlier pre-roman history seems likely though much of the evidence has been destroyed by later Roman work on the site.
bibliography: Frere, S. S. In Problems of Iron Age in S Britain, 20, 1958.
Holleyman, and Burstow. “Excavations at Muntham Court, Findon.” Sussex Notes and Queries, 1956.
———. “Excavations at Muntham Court, Findon, Sussex.” Brighton and Hove Archaeological Society, 1955.
———. “Excavations at Muntham Court, Findon, Sussex.” Brighton and Hove Archaeological Society, 1957.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Muntham Court, Findon (West Sussex).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Smith, Alex. “The Fate of Pagan Temples in Sount-East Britain during the Late and Post-Roman Periods.” In Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain, edited by David Rudling, 2008.
